This year, House Democrats built on the legacy of the #BradyBill by passing #HR8 my bipartisan bill to expand background checks. Another reminder that it’s long past time for McConnell to do his job and hold a vote on that bill to help keep our communities safe from gun violence.
Since it was implemented, the #BradyBill has stopped more than 3 million sales to prohibited purchases like convicted felons and domestic abusers.
Twenty six years ago, Congress passed the Brady Handgun Violence Prevention Act, the first background check bill to help prevent gun violence.

That’s why today I announced plans to introduce a bill to help make our electrical grid stronger so it can better withstand risks, reduce fire danger and prevent future power shutoffs.

Our district has been hit with power shutoff after power shutoff, leaving thousands of people in our community in the dark, hurting local businesses and leaving medically-vulnerable residents at great risk. This is unacceptable and cannot be our new normal.
